abstract_summ: Together, these data demonstrate that hPSC-derived lung cells infected by SARS-CoV-2 can model human COVID-19 disease and provide a valuable resource to screen for FDA-approved drugs that might be repurposed and should be considered for COVID-19 clinical trials.Mycophenolic acid and quinacrine dihydrochloride were found to block the infection of SARS-CoV-2 pseudo-entry virus in COs both in vitro and in vivo, and confirmed to block infection of SARS-CoV-2 virus.This study established both in vitro and in vivo organoid models to investigate infection of SARS-CoV-2 disease-relevant human colonic cell types and identified drugs that blocks SARS-CoV-2 infection, suitable for rapid clinical testing.Here, we advantageously used human reconstituted airway epithelial models of nasal or bronchial origin to characterize viral infection kinetics, tissue-level remodeling of the cellular ultrastructure and transcriptional immune signatures induced by SARS-CoV-2.We employed human intestinal organoids derived from pluripotent stem cells (PSC-HIOs) to analyze SARS-CoV-2 pathogenesis and to validate efficacy of specific drugs in the gut.
title_summ: Generation of human bronchial organoids for SARS-CoV-2 researchRemdesivir but not famotidine inhibits SARS-CoV-2 replication in human pluripotent stem cell-derived intestinal organoidsCharacterization and treatment of SARS-CoV-2 in nasal and bronchial human airway epitheliaIdentification of Drugs Blocking SARS-CoV-2 Infection using Human Pluripotent Stem Cell-derived Colonic OrganoidsSARS-CoV-2 infection of primary human lung epithelium for COVID-19 modeling and drug discoverySARS-CoV-2 Reverse Genetics Reveals a Variable Infection Gradient in the Respiratory TractIdentification of Candidate COVID-19 Therapeutics using hPSC-derived Lung Organoids
title_abstract_phrases: Together, these data demonstrate that hPSC-derived lung cells infected by SARS-CoV-2 can model human COVID-19 disease and provide a valuable resource to screen for FDA-approved drugs that might be repurposed and should be considered for COVID-19 clinical trials.Mycophenolic acid and quinacrine dihydrochloride were found to block the infection of SARS-CoV-2 pseudo-entry virus in COs both in vitro and in vivo, and confirmed to block infection of SARS-CoV-2 virus.This study established both in vitro and in vivo organoid models to investigate infection of SARS-CoV-2 disease-relevant human colonic cell types and identified drugs that blocks SARS-CoV-2 infection, suitable for rapid clinical testing.Identification of Candidate COVID-19 Therapeutics using hPSC-derived Lung OrganoidsThe SARS-CoV-2 virus has caused already over 3.5 million COVID-19 cases and 250,000 deaths globally.We employed human intestinal organoids derived from pluripotent stem cells (PSC-HIOs) to analyze SARS-CoV-2 pathogenesis and to validate efficacy of specific drugs in the gut.
